audioText: Mes parents pouvaient toujours m'emmener au parc le dimanche à l'époque où j'étais petit.
question: What did the speaker's parents always do when he was little?
options: They could always take him to the park on Sundays
They would always take him to the park on Sundays
They had to take him to the park on Sundays
They wanted to take him to the park on Sundays
explanation: The text states 'Mes parents pouvaient toujours m'emmener au parc le dimanche à l'époque où j'étais petit' - My parents could always take me to the park on Sundays back when I was little. 'Pouvaient' is the imperfect of 'pouvoir' (could/were able to), with the temporal clause repositioned at the end.
